channel.title: Radio War Nerd
channel.description: This is an example of how to use rfeed to generate an RSS 2.0 feed

item.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #20—February 10, 2016
item.description:
Guest: Tim Shorrock, author of "Spies For Hire" and NatSec blogger for The Nation


Deep-dive interview with investigative reporter Tim Shorrock on the roots of the recurring North Korea crises . . . we spend time recovering the gruesome lost history of North Korea, South Korea & the Korean War — and the US role in keeping the hostilities simmering . . . 


Direct link to this episode's mp3.
item.author: Santiago L. Valdarrama

item.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #18—January 27, 2016
item.description:
Guest: Patrick Cockburn, author of "The Rise of Islamic State" (Verso Books)


Great hour-long interview with legendary war correspondent Patrick Cockburn on Islamic State and his years reporting from Iraq, Syria and Libya [starts at 48:00 mark]  . . . Before our Cockburn interview, Nerd and Ames yammer about the wide world of wars: Oregon campground war leaves 1 dead, 7 arrested . . . Smug vs Scold—leftist media responses . . . Erdogan's brutal political calculations in waging war on Kurds in SE Turkey . . . Saudi megabucks to Malaysian PM & the spread of Wahhabism . . . Putin's attack on Bolsheviks (vs respect for Stalin) . . . Neocon bum fights—Kagan duo say their terrorists worse than Petraeus' terrorists . . . Chomsky supports bombing ISIS (and the War Nerd feels better about himself) . . . 


Direct link to this episode's mp3
item.author: Santiago L. Valdarrama

item.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #17—January 21, 2016
item.description:
Dateline: Turino—The War Nerd finally settles into Comms room—in Turin . . . a luggage miracle? . . . Newsflash: Putin "probably ordered" Litvinenko poisoning . . . "probably"? . . . US admits Russia airstrikes in Syria effective, but— . . . ISIS austerity wage cuts for jihadis . . . Iraq bloodbath . . . Obama authorizes military attacks on ISIL-K, looking back at original 2001 AUMF used as rationale for wars, torture, warrantless eavesdropping—opposed only by Barbara Lee, not Ron Paul or Bernie Sanders . . . 10,000 year old mass grave . . . Sri Lanka civil war between Tamil Tigers and Sinhalese [Continued] — why it matters, what happened, how it ended [hint: badly] . . . 


Direct link to this show's mp3.
item.author: Santiago L. Valdarrama

item.title: Radio War Nerd, Special Episode #15—January 10, 2016
item.description:
Dateline: Portland—A special between-shows Radio War Nerd interview with photojournalist Jason Wilson, the first journalist on the scene in Oregon's standoff between Bundy/militia/ranchers and federal authorities. Wilson reports mostly for The Guardian. We talk about the Bundy Bunch, their tactical positions and weapons, and their politics & culture compared to Wilson's native Oz ranchers.


Direct link to mp3 here.


Follow Jason Wilson on Twitter.
item.author: Santiago L. Valdarrama

item.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #14—January 6, 2016
item.description:
Dateline: London — The Mormon-Nerd Episode . . . New intro segment reading top War News headlines . . . North Korea H-bomb & the usual Western "skepticism" . . .  Saudis resume massive bombing in Yemen . . . Patrick Cockburn on Saudi imperial overreach . . . Erdogan's war on Kurds & Turkey's Red Staters . . . Sisi's war on "Sinai State" . . .  Israelis surprisingly down on Jewish terrorists . . . Mormons & Oregon militia standoff . . . the little-known history of Mormons' battles with Middle America's Ulster Protestant tribes & Washington DC . . . 


Link to episode mp3
item.author: Santiago L. Valdarrama

item.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #12—December 23-26, 2015
item.description:
Dateline: London — Extra-long 2-hour Radio War Nerd episode in two parts: Part I lasts until we get cut off at 47 minute mark, we talk about weird agendas at Amnesty International . . . Seymour Hersh's new bombshell article on Syria War and military brass working around strategically absent Obama Admin. Comms drop — then Part II we learn why the War Nerd was incommunicado for 3 days . . . Russian jets take out leader of Saudi-backed Army of Islam in Damascus suburb . . . "tamed jihadis" vs the real thing . . . back to Seymour Hersh's article, Putin's strategic thinking vs Obama's . . .


Link to episode mp3: http://exiledonline.com/wnradio/WN%20Podcast12.mp3
item.author: Santiago L. Valdarrama

item.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #11—December 16, 2015
item.description:
Dateline: Turin — Houbara bustards vs Qatari royal sheiks . . . American terrorism panic, GOP woofers & their deep faith in Curtis LeMay carpetbombers  . . .  Mosul, Al-Raqqah parallels . . . distinguishing between different Kurdish power-factions . . . weird alliance between Barzani & Erdogan . . . Trying to make sense of Mosul . . . Siege of Turin . . . Nigeria massacre of Shia cult . . .


Direct link to mp3: http://exiledonline.com/wnradio/WN%20Podcast11.mp3
item.author: Santiago L. Valdarrama

item.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #10—December 9, 2015
item.description:
Dateline: Budapest—With Trump talking about ethnic expulsions, a brief history of population transfers, ethnic cleansing, expulsions . . . The War Nerd writes to Amnesty International about their weird report accusing Kurdish YPG/J of ethnic cleansing; Amnesty wrote back to the War Nerd: "Amnesty International does not accuse the YPG of ethnic cleansing . . . " Biblical ethnic cleansing & Yahweh . . . Spain's expulsion of Jews (including Ames' family) . . . eastern Turkey & Armenia . . . Sudan, Congo . . . British Empire ran of population transfers . . . New Model Army . . . Meanwhile in Mosul . . . Remarque's "All Quiet on the Western Front" is a bummer . . .  


Link to mp3 here: http://exiledonline.com/wnradio/War%20Nerd%20Episode%2010.mp3
item.author: Santiago L. Valdarrama

item.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #9 — December 3, 2015
item.description:
Link to mp3 here: http://exiledonline.com/wnradio/War-Nerd-Episode-9.mp3

Dateline: Budapest McDonalds. . . Opium Wars in San Jose (or "stealing one's mom's Vicodins") . . . Trump lies about Civil War battle, angers war pedants . . . Mercenaries — UAE hires Colombians to fight in Yemen, as mercenaries increasingly become the norm . . . 21st C political economies make mercenary work sensible . . . "progress" in Yemen war . . . [technical difficulties . . . ] San Bernardino massacre as hybrid of workplace massacre + Islamist "terrorism" . . . DUNE: 50th anniversary of Frank Herbert's novel . . . does it hold up? . . . Bay Area literary scene in 1965 . . . Herbert/Vance/Le Guin/Dick vs Updike/Mailer/Pynchon . . . novel vs David Lynch film . . .
item.author: Santiago L. Valdarrama

item.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #8 — November 25, 2015
item.description:
Dateline: Budapest . . . What really happened when Turkey shot down the Russian Su-24 . . . The US equivalent: the F-111, used by Reagan to bomb Gaddafi's daughter's tent . . . the Islamist TOW shot on the Russian Mi-8 rescue helicopter . . . our military expert "Dan"'s two cents . . . fighter pilots are arrogant assholes . . . Hungary's 1956 uprising . . .


Here's a link to higher-quality mp3 version: http://exiledonline.com/wnradio/War-Nerd-Episode-8.mp3
item.author: Santiago L. Valdarrama

item.title: Radio War Nerd #7 - November 14, 2015
item.description: Around the Wars in 8 minutes; Veterans Day holiday & WW1; Genocide & Greece; Genocide & Burundi
item.author: Santiago L. Valdarrama

item.title: War Nerd Wednesday #6, 28th October 2015
item.description: Topics: Najran's Shia, Aleppo offensive, Qatar "threats" & the Reagan loonies in October 1983 were a lot loonier than we ever imagined
item.author: Santiago L. Valdarrama

item.title: War Nerd Wednesday: 2nd September 2015
item.description: The latest episode, featuring Gary Brecher and Mark Ames.
item.author: Santiago L. Valdarrama

item.description:
Radio War Nerd Episode #1 — August 19 2015


Inaugural show: Noble failed effort at "8 wars/8 minutes"...Turkey bombing Kurds in Syria while pretending to bomb Islamic State...depressing war in Ukraine/Donbas, depressed Ukrainian volunteers killing themselves...the fall of Mosul...Saudi war on Yemen...Saudis & Israel: the Love that dare not show its name...Israeli AF never once hitting Sunni jihadis in Syria...the Soviet-Japan front during WW2...annoying anti-nuclear bomb scolds...
item.author: Santiago L. Valdarrama
